b9TjwFXa22BR58a30LpONA.text: Sunday lunch time and by accident I turned into a courtyard with many different restaurants and bars.The Mexican caught my eye and I had no trouble finding a table outside in said courtyard.The offer for a set lunch with soup, main dish and brownie / ice cream for desert - 18S$ - had to be checked out.Portions are not too big but as it's three courses I was still quite stuffed afterwards. Everything was tasty and at least as Mexican as Chilis ;)The waiters were nice and always checked on me, asked before serving the next course etc. They even managed to bring the ice tea without sugar but a little pot with sugar on the side.Really liked the place as you can sit outside in the shade and with a fen if you like. The food is good and inexpensive, the staff really nice, so where else to go for a lazy Sunday lunch and some book reading?

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Desert brownie - warm and very chocolate-ty but not too sweet
Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken Chimichanga
Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Outside seating area

PlWN8tAG01Vs2umc2f9SLg.text: Their tortilla soup is basically tomato broth with soft tortilla strips and a few chunks of avocado. Not worth the $11!

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Tortilla soup (lunch to-go)

FIsPsM0yMtOB2tjccZkywg.text: This is probably the closest to real Mexican food you will get in Singapore. Food was delicious and it was close enough that it made me feel at home. The jarritos are authentic so you must try them. I would give this place 5 stars if the prices weren't so outrageous. Expect to pay quite a bit for a burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Authentic Mexican jarritos

e_RasmP292_55PVXu0Ps3w.text: Is this the best Mexican food in Singapore? Hell to the no. Is this the best TEXMEX in Singapore? Hell to the YES! I came here on a Friday night with Michelle M. and there was a small band jamming and singing in Spanish! What a perfect way to start our TexMex adventure. We ordered nachos, crab enchiladas, beef burrito, and beef tacos. I didn't try the beef burrito, but the crab enchiladas and beef tacos deserve an ole! The enchilada sauce wasn't as flavorful as I would like, but it definitely tasted like enchilada sauce so me gusta! It didn't taste much different from Chevy's enchiladas, which I faintly recall. Plus, the nice chunks of crab meat gave it a distinctive local flavor. Kind of like chili crab but no need for messy hands or a bowl of lemon water. The tacos are also worth the $17 as the price included 3 soft shelled tacos, rice, refried beans, and a small salad. Not bad considering Lucha Loco charges $11 for just one taco. The refried beans were also delicioso, def. an item I'll order as a side or even as an appetizer. I'm no nacho lover, but Viva Mexico's nachos blew me away. They came with REAL jalapenos! Nice big, fat vinegary ones!   ¡Salud! I was so happy I almost burst into tears...do you know how difficult it is to find jalapenos in Singapore?? My homemade Mexican food just doesn't taste the same without them. Viva Mexico (and Subway, I guess), tell me who your distributor is, por favor! I need them jalapenos! This certainly isn't the best TexMex I've had in my life, but for Singapore, I'm thoroughly impressed. For the price, atmosphere, and food--me encanta! For those who really crave Mexican food, visit Siem Reap, Cambodia. ¡Mi numero uno!

80QkqDdYgVH56Dv84YGj9Q.text: This a a review of a Tuesday evening dinner with a friend at Viva Mexico.First, I want to be clear,  in California, this would NOT be a four star review.  For a Mexican or Tex-Mex restaurant, It might only be a two star review.  But I am not in California and I have to adjust my expectations to where I'm at. I will also note that on their site, Viva Mexico claims to be  traditional Mexican food and not Tex-Mex.  While they have some moles, from what I saw of their menu, it is mostly Tex-Mex.  Plus, the fajitas seem to be pretty popular.  They are as Tex-Mex as it gets.My goal was to find a place that served decent US chain (El Toritios, etc..) quality Tex-Mex food.  My mission was a success.  In almost every way, this is exactly what Viva Mexico is.  This is true from the ambiance to the food.Speaking of the ambiance; it is festive.  Well, it is in the festive get out the decorations for taco night sort of way.  But it sets the mood for having a margarita or two.  And speaking of margarita's theirs are pretty good.  Nothing to write home about, but good enough to keep the Viva Mexico mood going.  It seemed like everyone there was in good spirits and enjoying their meals.  For me, this was a nice plus to the overall ambiance.The staff was friendly, professional, and prompt.  This was maintained throughout our meal.  This even included a moment where the power went out.  But that was only a very minor hiccup.The food was quite good.Nachos - We started with some nachos.  We enjoyed them very much.  I sought out the jalapeños.  My friend did everything she could to eat around them.  The chips were crisp.   The cheese was all melted.  This is all just as it should be.tinyurl.com/bz5eu8nGuacamole - We also ordered a side of guacamole.  This was also very good.  There were lots of fresh ingredients.  They had also insured not to over mix it so there was still some texture.tinyurl.com/aleeo7jFajitas - I ordered chicken.  She ordered beef.  I thought both were good.  I love fajitas.  I love food where you get to do a little bit of combining and playing while eating.  Being her first adventure with fajitas, my friend did not embrace this part as much.  She abandoned the create your own fajita taco and stuck with the fork and knife.  I thought that both the chicken and beef were cooked well.  They were both tender and had nice seasoning.  The veggies were still very crispy.  All in all -  two good sets of fajitas.tinyurl.com/abmcj9qOverall - This was a fun meal.  The food was good.  The service was pleasant.  The ambiance was on the festive side.  Good stuff!  I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Nachos - Viva Mexico - Singapore
Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Guacamole - Viva Mexico - Singapore
Photo of Viva Mexico - Singapore, Singapore. Fajitas - Viva Mexico - Singapore

ikrGfCuvD0pAIPl80dBOUg.text: The food is quite good. The portions are definitely on the small side. It looks like the side of rice that comes with the enchilada was measured in a 1/4 cup container and it retained the shape. The steak that came with the fajitas was big. Everything was well flavored.

cY1IKxnvQa5isgKDtAhHXA.text: I have to agree with J N, I'm really struggling to understand why this restaurant has received such great reviews. I don't claim to be a TexMex expert but the "kitchen sink burrito", which has received plaudits on both Yelp & Foursquare, was clearly prepared well in advance. The tortilla was stale, as were the nachos we ordered, and this is simply unacceptable. The cardboard-like texture of microwaved corn chips is not something I enjoy, much less am willing to pay for.The main reasons I've given this place two stars instead of one are the service and the vibe. Staff were quite attentive, friendly and hospitable and the al-fresco setting on Cuppage Rd is a winner. This is a great place to have a bucket of Coronas but if you're coming for the food then you will leave disappointed.

IOfwYgxXaAxvhqAeWPeBDQ.text: In fairness, if I could give this a 3.5, I probably would. The food was very tasty but having 'grown up' on Mexican, I am a pretty harsh critic.  We had the fajitas (beef), the crab enchiladas and my oldest daughter had the tacos. All were pretty darn good.  The beef in the fajitas was especially tasty. The service was good and the price was pretty reasonable too - we had three adult meals, a kids meal, a couple of cocktails and an appetizer for $160. Well worth it!  I will definitely go back (it was my wife's second time so you know she liked it).

ynq7jDd9yiZDyQcZyFCGhA.text: My boyfriend and I are from California and he's been in Asia for 6 months so we were excited to find a Mexican restaurant near our hotel. He ordered the kitchen sink burrito and I the chicken quesadilla. Both of our meals were excellent! He was more impressed then I simply because its been so long! The quesadilla was good, but how can one really mess that up. All in all we had a great dinner, fast service and typical Mexican restaurant ambience. We will be eating here again although prices were high but they are at all restaurants in Singapore. Yum!

qGFuIDwZlnrpCXzKz9XcEg.text: If you want Mexican food cooked by non-Mexicans, you pays your money and you takes your chances.The "Mexican" sauce tasted exactly like Heinz BBQ sauce + Tabasco.Went here a years ago, and while it wasn't real Mexican then either (check out the kitchen and staff and see for yourself), it was slightly better than this trip.The food was awful and the portions didn't match the cost. Another overpriced tourist trap.

9ZL0ac5wrXZbHDnOw3uGOg.text: The food is mediocre, but the price is high. Food is clearly prepared well in advance and simply heated on demand, which is fine for Baja Fresh, but not acceptable at $24 per plate.The service was very aggressive about clearing the plates, which gives the feeling of being rushed out. My wife had a margarita, which was weak by her standard, which is not high. I'm not sure why others have rated this place so highly, but it just doesn't live up to 4 stars it was given.

D_-Onq_2_8LMIAemoz1AMg.text: A bit pricey, but good Mexican food. Friendly staff. A nice place to have spent Cinco de Mayo.
